This document is not an API documentation, because there is no API; instead it is a collection of implementation notes.

          Description

Packages
de.halirutan.mathematica This package provides a custom language plugin for IntelliJ IDEA to support the Mathematica language.
de.halirutan.mathematica.actions Provides so-called Actions which implement various features.
de.halirutan.mathematica.codeInsight Provides features which generally help to ease coding and prevent errors while typing in the editor.
de.halirutan.mathematica.codeInsight.completion Provides various auto-completion features.
de.halirutan.mathematica.codeInsight.editor Provides functionality for basic and advanced syntax highlighting.
de.halirutan.mathematica.documentation Provides a system to display on the fly usage messages for all built-in functions and options.
de.halirutan.mathematica.fileTypes Provides information about the file-types which are supported by the plugin.
de.halirutan.mathematica.lexer Provides everything to do a lexical analysis of Mathematica input and divide it into lexer tokens.
de.halirutan.mathematica.module Provides classes to create Mathematica modules, projects and files from scratch.
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing Provides various functionality to parse Mathematica input into an Abstract Syntax Tree and several algorithms on those trees.
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.prattParser A combination of a recursive descent and operator precedence parser for Mathematica
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.prattParser.parselets Provides all the small parselets which actually do the work of parsing one single operation with its operands.
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi Provides interfaces and functionality for the internal representation of Mathematica code within a so-called Program Structure Interface (PSI tree).
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api.arithmetic  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api.assignment

de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api.files

de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api.rules  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.api.string  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.arithmetic  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.assignment  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.comparison  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.files  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.function  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.lists  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.logical  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.pattern  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.rules  
de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.psi.impl.string  
de.halirutan.mathematica.sdk Provides information and features to support a Mathematica SDK within IDEA.

 

This document is not an API documentation, because there is no API; instead it is a collection of implementation notes. I tried to put as much useful information in the java comments as possible to explain how algorithms are working and how the IDEA openAPI was used implement the various features. Therefore, these pages are for people who want to extend the code with additional functionality or for people creating their own custom language plugin. Those people might find some useful tips regarding the use of the openAPI, the implementation of a Mathematica parser, how highlighting and code annotation work or other things.

Where to start

In a first step in order to compile the plugin you need to setup IDEA for plugin development. For this purpose I wrote an article explaining this step by step which can be found in the Wiki of the plugins GitHub repository.
Otherwise, I suggest start at plugin.xml in the resources directory and just skim through it. You'll see, that every feature is registered in this file and from there you can navigate with Ctrl+Click on the implementing classes. You'll see that many features are easy and require almost no logic while others (like lang.parserDefinition) require a lot of code if you follow all implementations.
